How Not to Read a Headline on AI (ft. new Olympiad Gold, GPT-5 …)
| AI Explained | July 21, 2025
GPT-5 did what? OpenAI ahead of Google? There are 9 ways to misread the headlines of the last 48 hours, so this video is here to tell you what happened, sans sizzle. It’s been a fairly momentous last few days, so let’s dive in to the International Math Olympiad Gold, GPT-5 alpha release, whether mathematicians are out of jobs, and the white collar impact by year’s end.

News 📰️
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Uber CEO Making Autonomous Burritos?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 14, 2025
Ex-Uber CEO Travis Kalanick is making waves with his new venture in food automation, launching fully robotic restaurants dubbed ‘Cloud Kitchens’.
B.)
The Best AI Video Restyle Yet!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 14, 2025
Dive into innovative AI tools with a focus on Mago’s groundbreaking video-to-video restyler, which addresses key challenges like lip-syncing. Additionally, gain insights into HiggsField’s character consistency feature and explore Magnific’s non-creative AI image upscaler, both of which are poised to elevate your content creation experience.
C.)
Amazon Unveils Kiro, A Claude-Powered AI Rival To Windsurf And Codex, Sparking Developer Interest
| VentureBeat.com | July 14, 2025
Amid the big news that Windsurf is being acquired by Cognition (after its founders went to Google), developers interested in AI-powered coding may be on the hunt for new alternatives.
D.)
Anthropic, Google, OpenAI, xAI Awarded Up To $200M By US Defense Department For AI Development
| CNBC.com | July 14, 2025
The U.S. Department of Defense on Monday said it’s granting contract awards of up to $200 million to several AI companies. The DoD’s Chief Digital and Artificial Intelligence Office said the awards will help the agency accelerate its adoption of AI solutions. The recipients of the contract awards include Anthropic, Google, OpenAI and xAI.
E.)
Almost Timely News: 🗞️ Unconventional Deep Research Use Cases
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | July 13, 2025
Christopher Penn unveils strategies to harness the capabilities of AI deep research tools effectively. Utilizing the CASINO framework, he guides viewers through automating job hunts, conducting comprehensive competitive analysis, and identifying critical gaps in content strategies to enhance audience engagement.
July 22, 2025 📅️
2.)

. Scheduling is optional.

today.
4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | July 22, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
July 21, 2025 📅️
5.)
Logan Kilpatrick: Windsurf Acquisition, Gemini 3, Agentic Browsing, Veo 4, and More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 21, 2025
Logan Kilpatrick explores significant advancements in AI, including the recent Windsurf acquisition and the capabilities of Gemini 3 in browsing technologies. The discussion also addresses the evolving role of models in technology and the implications for white-collar jobs, providing valuable insights and forecasts for the future of AI tools.
6.)
How Not to Read a Headline on AI (ft. New Olympiad Gold, GPT-5 …)
| AI Explained | YouTube.com | July 21, 2025
Recent developments in AI and mathematics present a significant shift, particularly with the alpha release of GPT-5 and the International Math Olympiad Gold. The implications for the job market and the interaction between OpenAI and Google are explored, questioning whether fears around job security in white-collar sectors are warranted.
7.)
Cyberattacks By AI Agents Are Here – Cybersecurity Is Losing To AI
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | July 21, 2025
Autonomous AI-driven cyberattacks are increasingly targeting networks, manipulating data, and evading advanced security measures. As these threats evolve, concerns grow among governments and corporations alike regarding the safety of personal and sensitive information in the digital realm.
8.)
ChatGPT Agent Is Wild…
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 21, 2025
Explore the groundbreaking features of the ChatGPT Agent, showcasing its wild capabilities through engaging demos and benchmarks. This presentation highlights risks inherent in advanced AI tools while providing a comprehensive overview of performance metrics.
9.)
Somebody In AI Won A Math Gold Medal… But Was It OpenAI Or Google?
| TheNeuron.ai | July 21, 2025
OpenAI and potentially Google have claimed a significant achievement at the 2025 International Mathematical Olympiad, but details remain unclear amid competing narratives about the nature of this success. The implications of AI performance in rigorous testing scenarios raise important questions about the capabilities and verification of AI models.
July 19, 2025 📅️
10.)
AI News: ChatGPT’s New Tool Is… Still Loading
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 19, 2025
This week reveals exciting developments in AI tools, highlighted by the launch of ChatGPT’s new agent tool, which showcases proactive task management capabilities. Other notable updates include innovations from Anthropic, Hume AI, and Adobe Firefly, all contributing to the evolving landscape of artificial intelligence.
11.)
OpenAI’s LLM Excels at International Math Olympiad with Gold Medal-Level Performance
| Alexander Wei on X | July 19, 2025
I’m excited to share that our latest @OpenAI experimental reasoning LLM has achieved a longstanding grand challenge in AI: gold medal-level performance on the world’s most prestigious math competition — the International Math Olympiad (IMO).
July 18, 2025 📅️
12.)
ChatGPT Agent Full Breakdown & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | July 18, 2025
OpenAI’s release of ChatGPT Agent marks a significant advancement in AI, merging features from both Operator and Deep Research. Explore the latest AI innovations, including Grok Companions, through live testing and concise updates that encapsulate the fast-evolving landscape of artificial intelligence.
13.)
OpenAI’s New ChatGPT Agent Might’ve Just Stolen Your Job
| AI for Humans | YouTube.com | July 18, 2025
OpenAI unveils its new ChatGPT Agent, combining advanced research and operational capabilities to reshape the landscape of AI and work. As significant developments unfold, including corporate shifts among AI titans, this week captures the seismic changes in the AI ecosystem.
14.)
GPU Poor? Try This for Uncensored Open Source AI Video & Images!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 18, 2025
Explore the innovative approach to utilizing powerful GPUs at a significantly reduced cost, making high-quality AI video and image generation accessible for all. With easy-to-follow guidance on setting up accounts and deploying models, anyone can create impressive AI content without the need for expensive hardware.
15.)
Turn ChatGPT Into Your Digital Marketing Team
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | July 18, 2025
Master the art of utilizing ChatGPT as an effective digital marketing assistant. By implementing streamlined workflows, you can enhance productivity, optimize research, and automate tasks, ultimately freeing up valuable time for more strategic endeavors.
16.)
OpenAI’s New Agent Is Here
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 18, 2025
OpenAI has released a new general-purpose agent called “ChatGPT Agent” that can perform various tasks online, including browsing the web and executing code. The agent aims to automate complex professional tasks, showing promising performance compared to human capabilities in specific applications.
17.)
How Distillation Makes AI Models Smaller And Cheaper
| QuantaMagazine.org | July 18, 2025
Knowledge distillation is a crucial technique in AI that allows a large, expensive teacher model to train a smaller, more efficient student model by sharing nuanced information about categorization. This method has gained prominence in AI development, particularly for making complex models more accessible and cost-effective without significant loss of accuracy.
18.)
Italian YouTuber Faces Jail Time For Showing Android Handhelds With Emulated Games
| Wired.com | July 18, 2025
An Italian YouTuber, known as Once Were Nerd, may face criminal charges for allegedly promoting pirated games via his videos on Android-based handheld consoles. Italian authorities confiscated more than 30 gaming devices from him, highlighting a significant crackdown on copyright violations in the gaming industry.
19.)
Anthropic Quietly Imposes Stricter Usage Limits For Claude Code, Impacting Heavy And Max Plan Users
| TechCrunch.com | July 18, 2025
Since Monday morning, Claude Code users have been hit with unexpectedly restrictive usage limits. The problems, many of which have been aired on Claude Code’s GitHub page, seem to be concentrated among heavy users of the service, many of whom are on the $200-a-month Max plan.
20.)
Delta Air Lines Uses AI To Optimize Ticket Prices, Reports Strong Results From New Pricing Strategy
| TheVerge.com | July 18, 2025
Delta Air Lines is leaning into dynamic ticket pricing that uses artificial intelligence to individually determine the highest fee you’d willingly pay for flights, according to comments Fortune spotted in the company’s latest earnings call. Following a limited test of the technology last year, Delta is planning to shift away from static ticket prices entirely after seeing “amazingly favorable” results.
21.)
DuckDuckGo Adds Option To Hide AI-Generated Images From Search Results As Web Faces AI Content Surge
| TechCrunch.com | July 18, 2025
Privacy-focused browser DuckDuckGo is rolling out a new setting that lets users filter out AI images in search results. The company says it’s launching the feature in response to feedback from users who said AI images can get in the way of finding what they’re looking for.
22.)
Netflix Confirms Using Generative AI To Reduce Costs On Major Sci-Fi Series The Eternaut
| TheVerge.com | July 18, 2025
The Eternaut’s team generated a scene of a building collapsing with AI.
July 17, 2025 📅️
23.)
How They Made These Memes Go Viral
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 17, 2025
Gain valuable insights into maximizing the potential of Veo3 while exploring effective strategies for meme creation. The session takes a deep dive into pushing the tool beyond its limits and offers alternative solutions when faced with challenges in the creative process.
24.)
Introduction To ChatGPT Agent
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | July 17, 2025
Sam Altman, Casey Chu, Isa Fulford, Yash Kumar, and Zhiqing Sun delve into the innovative features of the unified agentic model in ChatGPT. A live demonstration showcases the capabilities and potential impact of this advanced conversational AI technology.
25.)
Perplexity CEO: Browser Wars, Taking on Google, White Collar Jobs and More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 17, 2025
The CEO of Perplexity delves into the complexities of the ongoing browser wars and articulates strategies to effectively compete against giants like Google. The discussion also touches upon the future of white-collar jobs in an AI-driven world.
26.)
OpenAI’s New ChatGPT Agent Tries to Do It All
| Wired.com | July 17, 2025
OpenAI has introduced a new ChatGPT agent capable of completing various digital tasks utilizing a virtual browser and can generate files like PowerPoint presentations and Excel spreadsheets. This evolution reflects OpenAI’s strategy to monetize its chatbot while minimizing reliance on traditional enterprise software.
27.)
Roblox’s New Age Verification Feature Uses AI to Scan Teens’ Video Selfies
| Wired.com | July 17, 2025
Roblox is implementing a new Trusted Connections feature that uses AI to analyze teens’ video selfies for age verification, enhancing safety on the platform. The new system aims to provide minors with a safer chatting experience while addressing concerns about online predators and grooming behaviors.
28.)
This AI Warps Live Video In Real Time
| Wired.com | July 17, 2025
Decart has introduced an AI model named Mirage, capable of manipulating live video in real time, creating surreal visual transformations based on user prompts. The technology shows significant potential for livestreaming, gaming, and more, though it raises questions about unpredictability and representation in generated content.
29.)
Podcast: Did AI “Break” School? Or Will It “Fix” It?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 17, 2025
The latest podcast episode explores the impact of AI on education, highlighting an MIT study that shows students using AI for assignments struggle to retain knowledge. The episode also discusses innovative teaching methods, including an Austin school that has adopted AI tutoring, allowing students to learn more efficiently while engaging in extracurricular activities.
30.)
How To Build Your Own Agent
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 17, 2025
A recent insight reveals the fast-paced and secretive nature of OpenAI, highlighting the impressive speed at which products like Codex are developed. The article also emphasizes using n8n for building your own AI agents and describes the potential of new AI functionalities from various tech companies, setting a competitive landscape among leading AI firms.
31.)
Decart Launches Mirage To Enhance AI Model Evaluation And Transparency In Machine Learning Systems
| About.decart.ai | July 17, 2025
Today, we are releasing MirageLSD, the first Live-Stream Diffusion (LSD) AI video model that inserts your imagination into any live video feed — it is the difference between watching magic on a screen and making magic yourself. We are also showing a demo of Mirage, our platform (website today, iOS/Android coming next week), powered by the MirageLSD model.
32.)
Slack Adds AI-Powered Thread Summaries, Huddle Notes, Live Translations, And Channel Recaps
| Zdnet.com | July 17, 2025
The platform gets a functional upgrade with live translations, channel recaps, automated action items, and more. Here’s who can access them today.
33.)
Windsurf Releases Wave 11 Update With New Browser Tools, Voice Mode, And Checkpoints
| Windsurf.com | July 17, 2025
Earlier this week, we announced that Windsurf had been acquired by Cognition, the legendary team behind Devin. The two teams have been hard at work ramping up on each other’s codebases, and with our combined firepower we’re excited to keep pushing Windsurf to be the best agentic IDE. Without further ado, here’s what’s in Wave 11.
34.)
Mistral Adds Deep Research Mode And Advanced Features To Le Chat Chatbot For Greater Productivity
| TechCrunch.com | July 17, 2025
French AI lab Mistral introduced a range of new features to its Le Chat chatbot on Thursday that bring it closer to the capabilities of rivals like OpenAI and Google. The new update includes a new “deep research” mode, native multilingual reasoning, and advanced image editing.
35.)
Adobe Firefly Introduces Feature To Generate Custom Sound Effects From User Audio Cues
| Engadget.com | July 17, 2025
Support for Google’s Veo 3 has also been added.
36.)
UK’s £225M Isambard-AI Supercomputer Launches In Bristol, Aiming For Tech And Medical Breakthroughs
| TheGuardian.com | July 17, 2025
Hopes £225m Isambard-AI in Bristol will unleash new era of technological, medical and social breakthroughs.
37.)
Hume AI Launches EVI 3 Model For Advanced Voice And Speaking Style Cloning
| X.com | July 17, 2025
2024: Voice Cloning. 2025: What about personality cloning? Hume’s voice AI can now not only mimic your voice but also speaking style and language. It’s now available via our TTS and new speech-to-speech model, EVI 3, which is also launching today.
38.)
OpenAI Unveils ChatGPT Agent With Proactive Skills To Autonomously Complete Tasks For Users
| OpenAI.com | July 17, 2025
ChatGPT now thinks and acts, proactively choosing from a toolbox of agentic skills to complete tasks for you using its own computer.
39.)
Google Gemini Code Assist Adds Agent Mode And New IDE Enhancements In June Update
| Blog.google | July 17, 2025
Discover the latest updates to Gemini Code Assist.
40.)
Apple News+ Launches Emoji Game, A New Puzzle Feature For Subscribers To Solve Phrases With Emojis
| Apple.com | July 17, 2025
Today, Apple News+ debuted Emoji Game, an original puzzle that challenges subscribers to use emoji to complete short phrases. Emoji Game is now available in English for Apple News+ subscribers in the U.S. and Canada.
41.)
SunoMusic Unveils V4.5+: Enhanced Tools For Vocal Swaps, Instrumentals And Playlist Creativity
| X.com | July 17, 2025
Introducing v4.5+
New ways to create. Unlock 4.5+ and push your sound further. Swap vocals, flip instrumentals, or spark a song from any playlist — it’s creativity, upgraded.
July 16, 2025 📅️
42.)
AI News: Windsurf Drama, Meta Building ASI, Meta Closed Source? Grok 4 Drama, And More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 16, 2025
Breaking developments in AI technology unfold as fresh reports highlight a range of issues, from controversies surrounding Grok 4 to Meta’s progress on artificial superintelligence. Key insights and critical analyses reveal the evolving landscape and ethical implications of advanced AI systems.
43.)
How AI Could Solve Education (Instead of Breaking It)
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | July 16, 2025
In this episode of The Neuron Podcast, Corey Noles and Grant Harvey engage deeply with the complexities of AI in education, addressing key controversies such as the UCLA “CheatGPT” incident and MIT’s brain study. The episode also highlights forward-thinking educational models, innovative teacher training initiatives, and offers actionable strategies for enhancing learning experiences through AI.
44.)
Runway’s New Update Is An AI Video Gamechanger!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 16, 2025
Tim explores the groundbreaking Act Two feature from Runway, showcasing the impressive performance capture tool through the creation of a short film. The insights cover both the strengths and limitations of the technology, offering valuable lessons learned during the creative process.
45.)
Claude Is A Financial Analyst Now
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 16, 2025
Anthropic’s AI model Claude has entered the finance sector, providing new tools for financial analysts that can integrate external market data with internal firm data. Key features include handling complex financial tasks, running simulations, and improved data processing capabilities, making it a strong competitor to traditional tools like Bloomberg Terminal.
46.)
Google Adds AI-Generated News Summaries To Discover Page On iOS And Android
| TheVerge.com | July 16, 2025
New Discover cards on iOS and Android are compiling news from multiple sources as publishers face dwindling web traffic.
47.)
Lightricks Unveils New Tool Enabling Creators To Direct Long-Form AI-Generated Videos In Real Time
| SiliconAngle.com | July 16, 2025
Open-source artificial intelligence pioneer Lightricks Ltd. is raising the stakes with the launch of the industry’s first long-form AI-generated video model with livestreaming capabilities.
48.)
Google Launches AI Business Calling Feature And Introduces Gemini 2.5 Pro Upgrade To AI Mode
| TechCrunch.com | July 16, 2025
Google is rolling out an agentic AI-powered business-calling feature to all users in the United States, the company announced on Wednesday. The tech giant is also enhancing Google Search’s AI Mode by bringing its Gemini 2.5 Pro model to the search experience and introducing deep research capabilities.
49.)
Google Brings Gemini 2.5 Pro And Deeper Research Features To AI Search For Pro And Ultra Subscribers
| Blog.google | July 16, 2025
We’re rolling out powerful new capabilities in Search, including Gemini 2.5 Pro and Deep Search, to Google AI Pro and AI Ultra subscribers.
50.)
Google’s AI Agent Big Sleep Blocks Cyberattack Before It Happens, Setting New Security Benchmark
| M.economictimes.com | July 16, 2025
Google has pulled off something big. Its AI agent Big Sleep spotted and blocked a cyber exploit before it could hit, a first for artificial intelligence in threat prevention. CEO Sundar Pichai broke the news on Tuesday, posting on X, “New from our security teams: Our AI agent Big Sleep helped us detect and foil an imminent exploit. We believe this is a first for an AI agent — definitely not the last — giving cybersecurity defenders new tools to stop threats before they’re widespread.”
51.)
OpenAI Selects Google Cloud To Support ChatGPT And API, Expanding Its List Of Infrastructure Partners
| SeekingAlpha.com | July 16, 2025
Google has added a major new client for its cloud business, as OpenAI revealed today it will use the Google Cloud Platform for ChatGPT and its application programming interface, or API.
52.)
OpenAI And Anthropic Researchers Criticize xAI Safety Culture Amid Recent Scandals
| TechCrunch.com | July 16, 2025
AI safety researchers from OpenAI, Anthropic, and other organizations are speaking out publicly against the “reckless” and “completely irresponsible” safety culture at xAI, the billion-dollar AI startup owned by Elon Musk.
53.)
Scale AI To Lay Off 14% Of Staff, Cut 200 Employees And 500 Contractors After Meta Investment
| Bloomberg.com | July 16, 2025
The AI data-labeling company is laying off 200 full-time employees and will stop working with 500 contractors.
54.)
China Advances AI With Undersea Data Centers To Improve Cooling And Efficiency
| ScientificAmerican.com | July 16, 2025
To grow its economy, China is betting big on artificial intelligence, cloud computing and other digital technology — and a big part of that bet involves rapidly building data centers to boost computing power. But these massive collections of servers gobble up growing amounts of energy, and each one cycles through hundreds of thousands of gallons of water a day to carry away the heat they generate.
55.)
Midjourney Explores Enterprise API For Business Integration Applications
| X.com | July 16, 2025
We’re starting to investigate opening up an Enterprise API for people to start integrating Midjourney into their companies/services. If you’d like to apply, help us figure out what to provide, or just want follow-up updates please fill out our Enterprise API application below.
56.)
OpenAI: ChatGPT Plus Users Gain Record Mode Globally On MacOS
| X.com | July 16, 2025
Plus users, the mic is yours. Record mode is now available to ChatGPT Plus users globally in the macOS desktop app.
July 15, 2025 📅️
57.)
How Tom Bilyeu Uses AI + Why He’ll Never Hire Again
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | July 15, 2025
Tom Bilyeu reveals his innovative approach to leveraging artificial intelligence within his businesses, discussing the formation of a compact five-member A.I. team that enhances efficiency while maintaining creative output. The conversation covers custom A.I. training, the importance of technology in game development, and the potential societal impacts as businesses evolve.
58.)
Master Data Analysis With ChatGPT (In Just 12 Minutes)
| Jeff Su | YouTube.com | July 15, 2025
Utilizing the DIG framework, learn to analyze datasets rapidly with ChatGPT, transforming it into your personal data analyst regardless of your technical background. Tailored for professionals seeking to enhance spreadsheet skills, this guide emphasizes practical methodologies for effective data analysis.
59.)
Meet Meta’s New “Prometheus” Data Center…
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 15, 2025
Meta has announced the construction of two large AI data centers that may significantly impact the U.S. power grid. The centers, named Prometheus and Hyperion, will utilize advanced technology and nuclear energy to support their vast computing needs, highlighting the potential risks associated with energy fluctuations during AI training.
60.)
Mistral AI Unveils Voxtral, Open Source Models For Advanced Speech Understanding
| Mistral.ai | July 15, 2025
Voice was humanity’s first interface — long before writing or typing, it let us share ideas, coordinate work, and build relationships. As digital systems become more capable, voice is returning as our most natural form of human-computer interaction.
61.)
Former OpenAI Engineer Reveals Challenges And Excitement Of Developing Codex AI Agent At The Company
| TechCrunch.com | July 15, 2025
Three weeks ago, an engineer named Calvin French-Owen, who worked on one of OpenAI’s most promising new products, resigned from the company.
62.)
Google Offers AI Training Scholarships To Virginians In Partnership With Virginia Works
| Blog.google | July 15, 2025
We’ve partnered with Virginia Works to offer Google Career Certificates and AI course scholarships to Virginians.
63.)
Nextdoor Adds AI-Powered Recommendations In Major App Redesign Integrating Human Conversations
| CNET.com | July 15, 2025
You’ll be able to discuss real-time emergencies and local news with your neighbors before turning to a bot for recommendations.
64.)
Thinking Machines Lab, Founded By Mira Murati, Hits $12B Valuation In Seed Funding Round
| TechCrunch.com | July 15, 2025
Thinking Machines Lab, the AI startup founded by OpenAI’s former chief technology officer Mira Murati, officially closed a $2 billion seed round led by Andreessen Horowitz on Monday, a company spokesperson told TechCrunch.
65.)
Anthropic Calls For Major Us Energy Investments To Secure Leadership In AI Infrastructure And Innovation
| Anthropic.com | July 15, 2025
Energy is central to winning the AI race and we need to ensure that America has the necessary infrastructure to maintain its lead. This includes reliable, abundant energy sources and modernized electric grids capable of supporting the computational and energy demands of advanced AI systems.
66.)
Anthropic Launches Claude AI Tool To Revolutionize Financial Analysis And Research For Finance Professionals
| Anthropic.com | July 15, 2025
Today, we’re introducing a comprehensive solution for financial analysis that transforms how finance professionals analyze markets, conduct research, and make investment decisions with Claude.
67.)
Anthropic Appoints Paul Smith As First Chief Commercial Officer, Starting Later This Year
| Anthropic.com | July 15, 2025
Anthropic will appoint Paul Smith as its first Chief Commercial Officer, who will assume the role later this year. Paul will bring over 30 years of experience building and scaling global go-to-market organizations at some of the world’s most successful enterprise technology companies, including Microsoft, Salesforce, and ServiceNow.
68.)
Mistral Launches Voxtral, Its First Open Source AI Audio Model To Rival Closed Corporate Systems
| TechCrunch.com | July 15, 2025
As AI systems become more capable, speech is fast becoming the default way we communicate with machines. French AI startup Mistral has jumped into the audio race with its first open model, aiming to challenge the dominance of walled-off corporate systems with open-weight alternatives.
69.)
xAI Updates Grok To Prevent Hitler References And Ensure Responses Are Not Based On Elon Musk’s Views
| TheVerge.com | July 15, 2025
Grok’s responses must come from ‘independent analysis,’ not Musk’s stated beliefs.
70.)
Google Cloud Uses AI To Predict Home Run Locations At MLB All-Star Game With Player Stats Analysis
| Blog.google | July 15, 2025
Google Cloud will use AI to predict where home runs may land, based on historic stats of players, in the stands — and use mobile billboards to share fun stats throughout Atlanta.
71.)
Runway Unveils Act-Two: Enhanced Motion Capture Model With Comprehensive Tracking Features
| X.com | July 15, 2025
Introducing Act-Two, our next-generation motion capture model with major improvements in generation quality and support for head, face, body and hand tracking. Act-Two only requires a driving performance video and reference character. Available now to all our Enterprise customers and Creative Partners.
72.)
Thinking Machines Lab Develops Multimodal AI For Enhanced Human Collaboration
| X.com | July 15, 2025
Thinking Machines Lab exists to empower humanity through advancing collaborative general intelligence.

Sponsor: Access Ready, Inc.
Help Access Ready, Inc. Rebuild After Hurricanes Helene and Milton
Help Access Ready, Inc. support people with disabilities after Hurricanes Helene and Milton.
Based in Saint Petersburg, Florida, Access Ready is committed to providing adaptive equipment, restoring independence and dignity to those affected. Many lost vital devices that help them communicate, work, and live independently.
Donations will go toward repairing or replacing this equipment, ensuring people can regain normalcy after the disaster. Every contribution directly aids recovery efforts.
Since 2018, Access Ready has promoted accessible technology, led by CEO Douglas George Towne.
Your support can make a real difference.

About:
Access to Information Is a Human Right. AIra is an app that connects people who are blind or low vision to professional visual interpreters for secure access to visual information, anytime, anywhere. Organizations who value accessibility and inclusivity partner with AIra to offer the app for free to their employees, students, and customers.
